detaileddescription.para: CPU Memory (Processor side).
GPU Memory (Graphic card side).

briefdescription.para: List available memory type.

detaileddescription.para: copy data from CPU to CPU.
copy data from CPU to GPU.
copy data from GPU to GPU.
copy data from GPU to CPU.

briefdescription.para: List available copy operation on Mat.

detaileddescription.para: float 1 channel.
float 2 channels.
float 3 channels.
float 4 channels.
unsigned char 1 channel.
unsigned char 2 channels.
unsigned char 3 channels.
unsigned char 4 channels.

briefdescription.para: List available Mat formats.

detaileddescription.para: 2208*1242, available framerates: 15 fps.
1920*1080, available framerates: 15, 30 fps.
1280*720, available framerates: 15, 30, 60 fps.
672*376, available framerates: 15, 30, 60, 100 fps.

briefdescription.para: List available video resolutions.

simplesect.para: Since v1.0, VGA mode has been updated to WVGA (from 640*480 to 672*376) and requires a firmware update to function (>= 1142). Firmware can be updated in the ZED Explorer.
NVIDIA Jetson boards do not support all ZED video resolutions and framerates. For more information, please read the on-line API documentation.

detaileddescription.para: Defines the brightness control. Affected value should be between 0 and 8.
Defines the contrast control. Affected value should be between 0 and 8.
Defines the hue control. Affected value should be between 0 and 11.
Defines the saturation control. Affected value should be between 0 and 8.
Defines the gain control. Affected value should be between 0 and 100 for manual control. If ZED_EXPOSURE is set to -1, the gain is in auto mode too.
Defines the exposure control. A -1 value enable the AutoExposure/AutoGain control,as the boolean parameter (default) does. Affected value should be between 0 and 100 for manual control.
Defines the color temperature control. Affected value should be between 2800 and 6500 with a step of 100. A value of -1 set the AWB ( auto white balance), as the boolean parameter (default) does.
Defines the status of white balance (automatic or manual). A value of 0 disable the AWB, while 1 activate it.

briefdescription.para: List available camera settings for the ZED camera (contrast, hue, saturation, gain...).

detaileddescription.para: Each enum defines one of those settings.
Self calibration has not run yet (no sl::Camera::open or sl::Camera::resetSelfCalibration called).
Self calibration is currently running.
Self calibration has finished running but did not manage to get accurate values. Old parameters are taken instead.
Self calibration has finished running and did manage to get accurate values. New parameters are set.

briefdescription.para: Status for self calibration.

detaileddescription.para: Since v0.9.3, self-calibration is done in background and start in the sl::Camera::open or Reset function. You can follow the current status for the self-calibration any time once ZED object has been construct.
This mode does not compute any depth map. Only rectified stereo images will be available.
Fastest mode for depth computation.
Balanced quality mode. Depth map is robust in any environment and requires medium resources for computation.
Best quality mode. Requires more compute power.

briefdescription.para: List available depth computation modes.

detaileddescription.para: This mode outputs ZED standard depth map that preserves edges and depth accuracy. Applications example: Obstacle detection, Automated navigation, People detection, 3D reconstruction.
This mode outputs a smooth and fully dense depth map. Applications example: AR/VR, Mixed-reality capture, Image post-processing.

briefdescription.para: List available depth sensing modes.
Enumerate for available metric unit of the depth.

detaileddescription.para: Standard coordinates system in computer vision. Used in OpenCV : see here : http://docs.opencv.org/2.4/modules/calib3d/doc/camera_calibration_and_3d_reconstruction.html
Left-Handed with Y up and Z forward. Used in Unity with DirectX.
Right-Handed with Y pointing up and Z backward. Used in OpenGL.
Right-Handed with Z pointing up and Y forward. Used in 3DSMax.
Left-Handed with Z axis pointing up and X forward. Used in Unreal Engine.

briefdescription.para: List available coordinates systems for positional tracking and points cloud representation.

detaileddescription.para: Positional tracking is provided in the given coordinates system.
Disparity map, 1 channel, FLOAT.
Depth map, 1 channel, FLOAT.
Certainty/confidence of the disparity map, 1 channel, FLOAT.
Point cloud, 4 channels, FLOAT, channel 4 is empty.
Colored point cloud, 4 channels, FLOAT, channel 4 contains color in R-G-B-A order.
Colored point cloud, 4 channels, FLOAT, channel 4 contains color in B-G-R-A order.
Colored point cloud, 4 channels, FLOAT, channel 4 contains color in A-R-G-B order.
Colored point cloud, 4 channels, FLOAT, channel 4 contains color in A-B-G-R order.

briefdescription.para: List retrievable measures.

detaileddescription.para: Rectified left image.
Rectified right image.
Rectified left grayscale image.
Rectified right grayscale image.
Raw left image.
Raw right image.
Raw left grayscale image.
Raw right grayscale image.
Left and right image (the image width is therefore doubled).
Normalized depth image.
Normalized confidence image.

briefdescription.para: List available views.

detaileddescription.para: PNG image format in 16bits. 32bits depth is mapped to 16bits color image to preserve the consistency of the data range.
stream of bytes, graphic image file format.
gray-scale image format.

briefdescription.para: List available file formats for saving depth maps.

detaileddescription.para: Generic point cloud file format, without color information.
Point Cloud Data file, with color information.
PoLYgon file format, with color information.
Visualization ToolKit file, without color information.

briefdescription.para: List available file formats for saving point clouds.

detaileddescription.para: Stores the spatial coordinates (x,y,z) of each pixel and optionally its RGB color.
The camera is searching for a previously known position to locate itself.
Positional tracking is working normally.
Positional tracking is not enabled.
Effective FPS is too low to give proper results for motion tracking. Consider using PERFORMANCES parameters (DEPTH_MODE_PERFORMANCE, low camera resolution (VGA,HD720))

briefdescription.para: List the different states of positional tracking.

detaileddescription.para: The spatial memory file has been successfully created.
The spatial memory is currently written.
The spatial memory file exportation has not been called.
The spatial memory contains no data, the file is empty.
The spatial memory file has not been written because of a wrong file name.
The spatial memory learning is disable, no file can be created.

briefdescription.para: List the different states of spatial memory area export.

detaileddescription.para: The transform of sl::Pose will contains the motion with reference to the world frame (previously called PATH).
The transform of sl::Pose will contains the motion with reference to the previous camera frame (previously called POSE).

briefdescription.para: Define which type of position matrix is used to store camera path and pose.

detaileddescription.para: The spatial mapping is initializing.
The depth and tracking data were correctly integrated in the fusion algorithm.
The maximum memory dedicated to the scanning has been reach, the mesh will no longer be updated.
Camera::enableSpatialMapping() wasn't called (or the scanning was stopped and not relaunched).
Effective FPS is too low to give proper results for spatial mapping. Consider using PERFORMANCES parameters (DEPTH_MODE_PERFORMANCE, low camera resolution (VGA,HD720), spatial mapping low resolution)

briefdescription.para: Gives the spatial mapping state.

detaileddescription.para: RAW images, no compression.
new Lossless, with PNG/ZSTD based compression : avg size = 42% of RAW).
new Lossy, with JPEG based compression : avg size = 22% of RAW).

briefdescription.para: List available compression modes for SVO recording.

detaileddescription.para: sl::SVO_COMPRESSION_MODE_LOSSLESS is an improvement of previous lossless compression (used in ZED Explorer), even if size may be bigger, compression time is much faster.
Contains only vertices and faces.
Contains only vertices and faces, encoded in binary.
Contains vertices, normals, faces and textures informations if possible.
Standard code for successful behavior.
Standard code for unsuccessful behavior.
No GPU found or CUDA capability of the device is not supported.
Not enough GPU memory for this depth mode please try a faster mode (such as PERFORMANCE mode).
The ZED camera is not plugged or detected.
For Jetson only, resolution not yet supported (USB3.0 bandwidth).
This issue can occurs when you use multiple ZED or a USB 2.0 port (bandwidth issue).
ZED calibration file is not found on the host machine. Use ZED Explorer or ZED Calibration to get one.
The provided SVO file is not valid.
An recorder related error occurred (not enough free storage, invalid file).
The requested coordinate system is not available.
The firmware of the ZED is out of date. Update to the latest version.
in grab() only, the current call return the same frame as last call. Not a new frame.
in grab() only, a CUDA error has been detected in the process. Activate verbose in sl::Camera::open for more info.
in grab() only, ZED SDK is not initialized. Probably a missing call to sl::Camera::open.
your NVIDIA driver is too old and not compatible with your current CUDA version.
the call of the function is not valid in the current context. Could be a missing call of sl::Camera::open.
The SDK wasn't able to load its dependencies, the installer should be launched.

briefdescription.para: List error codes in the ZED SDK.

memberdef.name: cameraResolution

detaileddescription.para: Available video modes for the ZED camera

memberdef.argsstring: (sl::Camera &zed, sl::DEPTH_FORMAT format, sl::String name, float factor=1.)
memberdef.name: saveDepthAs

briefdescription.para: Writes the current depth map into a file.

parameterdescription.para: : the depth file format you desired.
: the name (path) in which the depth will be saved.

: only for PNG and PGM, apply a gain to the depth value (default 1.). The maximum value is 65536, so you can set the Camera::setDepthClampValue to 20000 and give a factor to 3, Do not forget to scale (by 1./factor) the pixel value to get the real depth. The occlusions are represented by 0.

simplesect.para: False if something wrong happen, else return true.

memberdef.argsstring: (sl::Camera &zed, sl::POINT_CLOUD_FORMAT format, sl::String name, bool with_color=false, bool keep_occluded_point=false)
memberdef.name: savePointCloudAs

briefdescription.para: Writes the current point cloud into a file.

parameterdescription.para: : the point cloud file format you desired.
: the name (path) in which the point cloud will be saved.
: indicates if the color must be saved (default false). Not available for XYZ and VTK.
: indicates if the non available data should be saved and set to 0 (default false), if set to true this give a Point Cloud with a size = height * width.

simplesect.para: False if something wrong happen, else return true.
The color is not saved for XYZ and VTK files.

memberdef.argsstring: (cudaError err, const char *func, const char *file, const int line)
memberdef.name: __cudaSafeCall

briefdescription.para: Tells the program to wait for x ms.

parameterdescription.para: : the number of ms to wait.
